artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige II; Publisher: Fujiokaya Keijirō
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
(The Shōhei bridge over the Kanda river built in another side of the Sujikai bridge. There is the Confucious temple of Yushima close to the Shōhei bridge. It\'s told that the bridge was named after the Shōhei village in China where there is a famous Confucious temple. Before that the bridge was called Aioi bridge, they say.)

{Shōhei-bashi wa Sujikai-bashi ni narabite Kanda-gawa ni kakaru. Kore wa Yushima no chi ni seidō aru ni yotte Ro no Shōhei-kyō ni hishite nazukerare to ya. Kono hashi wa hajime Aioi-bashi to iishi to???}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Shōhei Bridge
